description: Hear the story of what happened when the Crooked Billet public house,  packed with people, was struck by a V2 rocket and how over 66 years later those who were killed and injured were to be commemorated by a blue plaque on the rebuilt pub.
facilities: Photography is not permitted on site

factsheet.heading: Historical Background
paragraphs: Seventy eight years ago, during the Second World War, London faced an unprecedented and terrifying threat  from a completely new weapon – the V2 rocket.  Travelling at over 3000 miles per hour, over four times faster than the speed of sound, no warning of its approach could be given and no defence was possible.  Hear the story of what happened when a public house, the Crooked Billet, packed with people was struck by a V2 rocket and how, in 2011, those who were killed and injured were to be commemorated by a blue plaque on the rebuilt pub.

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs: If you’re interested in discovering even more about the history of the Crooked Billet, Jennie Randall has written a book, Not Forgotten – The Crooked Billet (£4) which will be on sale at the end of the talk or by contacting 07840 542261. All profits go to charity.
